movesets.name: Support

items.name: Light Clay
items.description: Reflect and Light Screen last 8 turns.

movesets.description:
Moves

Reflect and Light Screen are the most important moves on the set, and they halve the damage taken from physical and special attacks, respectively. This allows Meowstic-M to support its teammates by letting them set up with ease. The third moveslot is a toss up. Yawn allows Meowstic-M to force some switches, and lets it set up more easily, though Thunder Wave cripples foes and its effects are instant. The last moveslot is also a matter of preference. Psychic hits harder most of the time, though Psyshock can be useful for getting past Pokemon such as Dragalge and Hariyama. Yawn can also be used in this moveslot as it allows you to be much more selective of what foe gets inflicted with what, and Meowstic-M is very weak without investment. However, if you choose to opt for Yawn over an attacking move, it will make Meowstic-M very susceptible to Taunt.

Set Details

The given EV spread maximizes Meowstic-M's ability to take physical hits and allows it to set up more easily. However, a specially defensive spread of 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD can be used to allow Meowstic-M switch into powerful attackers such as Magmortar with more ease. Light Clay increases the amount of turns Reflect and Light Screen are up. A Bold nature is used to further increase Meowstic-M's physical bulk.

Usage Tips

Use Thunder Wave or Yawn often to cripple opposing Pokemon; this serves as an emergency check to dangerous threats. In addition, use Reflect and Light Screen often to support your team's setup sweepers. If you opt for Yawn, after setting up dual screens, Meowstic-M can force an opposing Pokemon out.

Team Options

Meowstic-M is a great choice on hyper offensive teams as it is the only Pokemon in the tier with both Prankster and dual screens. Setup sweepers such as Linoone, Gorebyss, and Klinklang really appreciate the support Meowstic-M provides.

movesets.name: Utility

items.name: Light Clay
items.description: Reflect and Light Screen last 8 turns.

movesets.description:
Moves

Reflect and Light Screen form the dual screens combination and provide great support to the team in lessening the damage they take, making them a boon for hyper offense teams. Thunder Wave is present on the set in order to allow Meowstic-M to halt a fast attacker in their tracks. Like dual screens, this sort of support is much appreciated by hyper offense teams, as it can mean that an opposing rampant sweeper can be stopped from taking out your team. Psychic and Psyshock are Meowstic-M’s ways of dealing direct damage when the need arises. Psychic has greater Base Power, though Psyshock is useful for hitting opponents with lower Defense than Special Defense, such as Hitmonlee. It is a matter of a personal preference which attack you opt for.

Set Details

Maximum HP and Defense investmentand a Bold nature ensures that Meowstic-M can take physical hits as well as possible. Light Clay extends the duration of the screens to eight turns, allowing your team to take advantage of them for as long as possible.

Usage Tips

Setting up screens is the utmost priority. You may want to switch Meowstic-M out once it has set up its screens in order to let its teammates take advantage of them straight away. This also means Meowstic-M will have a chance to set them up again later on.

Team Options

Dual screens support is appreciated by the whole team, though setup sweepers such as Gorebyss, Cobalion, Durant, and Virizion particularly benefit from them, as they make setting up a lot easier. Memento Dugtrio can be a good partner for Meowstic-M in order to help setup sweepers by giving them another chance at successfully setting up if Meowstic-M's screens run out or it didn't get an opportunity to set them up again.

moves.name: Assist
moves.description: Uses a random move from the user's team.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Barrier
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Calm Mind
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Charge Beam
moves.description: 70% chance to boost Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Charm
moves.description: Lowers foe's Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confusion
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Covet
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Cut
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Dark Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Disarming Voice
moves.description: This attack never misses.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dream Eater
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt. Only works if target is asleep.

moves.name: Echoed Voice
moves.description: Power increases when used consecutively.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fake Out
moves.description: The user always moves first, and flinches the foe. Can only be used on the first turn out.

moves.name: Flash
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy 1 stage.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Helping Hand
moves.description: Increases power of ally's moves by 50%.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Imprison
moves.description: No foe can use any of the user's moves.

moves.name: Leer
moves.description: Lowers target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Light Screen
moves.description: Lowers damage from special attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Mean Look
moves.description: The target cannot switch out.

moves.name: Miracle Eye
moves.description: Nullifies evasion. Allows Psychic-type moves to hit Darks.

moves.name: Misty Terrain
moves.description: For five turns, Grounded Pokemon cannot have major status problems or confusion inflicted on them by other Pokemon. Their Dragon-type moves are weakened by 50%.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Power-Up Punch
moves.description: Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psybeam
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Psychic
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense 1 stage.

moves.name: Psyshock
moves.description: Damage is based on the target's Defense stat.

moves.name: Quick Guard
moves.description: Protects user and allies from priority attacks.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Reflect
moves.description: Lowers damage from physical attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Role Play
moves.description: Copies the foe's ability and overwrites the user's ability.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Safeguard
moves.description: Blocks status conditions for 5 turns.

moves.name: Scratch
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sucker Punch
moves.description: The user always moves first. Will only work if the foe attacked.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Thunder Wave
moves.description: Paralyzes the foe.

moves.name: Thunderbolt
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Trick
moves.description: Switches items with the foe.

moves.name: Trick Room
moves.description: Slower Pokemon move first for 5 turns.

moves.name: Yawn
moves.description: Puts the target to sleep after 2 turns.

abilities.name: Infiltrator
abilities.description: The wielder bypasses the foe's Light Screen, Reflect, Mist, Safeguard, and Substitute.

abilities.name: Keen Eye
abilities.description: Pokemon's accuracy cannot be lowered. Opponent's evasion boosts are ignored. Decreases wild encounter rate.

abilities.name: Prankster
abilities.description: Non-damaging moves have their priority increased by one level.
